meanings.definition: engaged in a profession or engaging in as a profession or means of livelihood

examples: the professional man or woman possesses distinctive qualifications
began her professional career after the Olympics

provision.definition:

2) evoke or provoke to appear or occur

I had allotted my own bedroom for necking, prudently removing both the bed and the key, and taken both myself and my typewriter into my son's bedroom.
she acts prudishly, but I wonder whether she is really all that chaste

prunella.definition:

psychedelia.definition: the subculture of users of psychedelic drugs

psychiatry.definition: the branch of medicine dealing with the diagnosis and treatment of mental disorders

psychiatric.definition: relating to or used in or engaged in the practice of psychiatry

psychic.definition:

2) outside the sphere of physical science

psychoactive.definition: affecting the mind or mood or other mental processes

psychophysics.definition: the branch of psychology concerned with quantitative relations between physical stimuli and their psychological effects

2) prepare and issue for public distribution or sale

4) become abundant; increase rapidly

2) produce or modulate (as electromagnetic waves) in the form of short bursts or pulses or cause an apparatus to produce pulses

punks.definition: a youth subculture closely associated with punk rock music in the late 1970s; in part a reaction to the hippy subculture; dress was optional but intended to shock (plastic garbage bags or old school uniforms) and hair was dyed in bright colors (in Mohican haircuts or sometimes spiked in bright plumes)

punster.definition: someone overly fond of making puns

punt.definition:
1) kick the ball
2) propel with a pole
3) (football) a kick in which the football is dropped from the hands and kicked before it touches the ground

punter.definition:
1) someone who propels a boat with a pole

pup.definition: young of any of various canines such as a dog or wolf

pupil.definition: the contractile aperture in the center of the iris of the eye; resembles a large black dot

puppeteer.definition: one who operates puppets or marionettes

puppetry.definition:

puppy.definition:

they closed the purchase with a handshake

purebred.definition: bred for many generations from member of a recognized breed or strain

1) serving to purge or rid of sin

1) oust politically

purim.definition: (Judaism) a Jewish holy day commemorating their deliverance from massacre by Haman

purine.definition:

purist.definition: someone who insists on great precision and correctness (especially in the use of words)

puritan.definition:
1) a member of a group of English Protestants who in the 16th and 17th centuries thought that the Protestant Reformation under Elizabeth was incomplete and advocated the simplification and regulation of forms of worship
2) someone who adheres to strict religious principles; someone opposed to sensual pleasures

puritanical.definition: of or relating to Puritans or Puritanism

puritanism.definition:
1) the beliefs and practices characteristic of Puritans (most of whom were Calvinists who wished to purify the Church of England of its Catholic aspects)
2) strictness and austerity in conduct and religion

purity.definition:
1) being undiluted or unmixed with extraneous material

purl.definition:
